proof:
Proof. Let $\mathcal{H} := \text{PARTITION}(G_{Base}, g)$ and $H_{Base} := \bigcup_{S \in \mathcal{H}} G_{Base}[S]$. We will divide the proof looking at the value of $d_{comp}$.

First case: If $d_{comp} < g$, then we define $\mathcal{H} := \mathcal{G}(H_{Base}, \frac{d_{comp}}{g}, g)$.
For all $H \in \text{supp}(\mathcal{H})$, $\Delta(H) \le 2 \cdot \frac{d_{comp}}{g} \cdot g = 2 \cdot d_{comp}$ by construction, proving Item 1.
These values of $p = \frac{d_{comp}}{g}$ and $d = g$ satisfy the requirements for the Compression Lemma. In particular, since $4 \ln(2n) \le d_{comp} < g$, we have $p = \frac{d_{comp}}{g} \in (0,1)$. Additionally, $d=g > \Delta(H_{Base})$ since each subgraph has at most $g$ vertices, and $d=g = \frac{d_{comp}}{d_{comp}/g} > \frac{4 \ln(2n)}{p}$. Therefore the constraints must be satisfied for $p$ and $d$.\Hence, there exists $\lambda$ such that $H_{Miss}(\lambda) = (V, E_{Miss}(\lambda))$ satisfies
$$|E_{Miss}(\lambda)| \le \frac{\ln(2) \cdot (s+1) \cdot g}{d_{comp}}$$
Let $(L,Q) := \text{SPLIT}(H_{Miss}(\lambda), d_{filter})$. By Proposition 3.3, $|Q| \le \frac{2|E_{Miss}(\lambda)|}{d_{filter}} \le \frac{2 \ln(2) \cdot (s+1) g}{d_{comp} \cdot d_{filter}}$, proving Item 5.
Furthermore, let $\mathcal{P} := \{S \cap L : S \in \mathcal{H}\}$. Since $\mathcal{H}$ is a partition of $V$ and $Q = V \setminus L$, we know that $\mathcal{P} \cup \{Q\}$ is a partition of $V$. By Fact 2.1, $|\mathcal{P}| = |\mathcal{H}| \le \lceil \frac{n}{g} \rceil$, proving Item 4.
We will now prove the conditions on all $P \in \mathcal{P}$. Let $X_P := H_{Miss}(\lambda)[P]$.
* By Proposition 3.3, since $P \subseteq L$, $\Delta(X_P) \le \Delta(H_{Miss}(\lambda)[L]) \le d_{filter}$. This proves Item 3.
* We know $P \subseteq S$ for some $S \in \mathcal{H}$. Additionally, $\mathcal{H}$ is a partition of $V$. So, by our construction of $H_{Base}$, we have $H_{Base}[S] = G_{Base}[S]$. Hence, since $P \subseteq S$, we have $H_{Base}[P] = G_{Base}[P]$. This proves Item 2.

Second case: If $d_{comp} \ge g$, then we let $\mathcal{H} = \mathcal{G}(H_{Base}, 1, |V|)$. We let $\mathcal{P} = \mathcal{H}$, so $Q = \emptyset$, which satisfies Item 5. The distribution $\mathcal{H}$ is a single graph $H_{Base}$. Since each subgraph in $\mathcal{H}$ has $\le g$ vertices, $\Delta(H_{Base}) \le g \le 2 \cdot d_{comp}$, proving Item 1. Since $|\mathcal{P}| = |\mathcal{H}|$, Item 4 is proven by Fact 2.1. Since $\text{supp}(\mathcal{H}) = \{H_{Base}\}$, $H_{Miss}(\lambda) = \emptyset$, proving Item 3. By how we defined $\mathcal{P}$ and $H_{Base}$ (note that $\mathcal{H}$ is a partition), $G_{Base}[P] = H_{Base}[P]$ for all $P \in \mathcal{P}$. This proves Item 2.
